insights.root_cause: The variations may be due to inconsistent accounting practices or errors in data entry.
insights.recommendation: Conduct a detailed review of accounting practices and data entry processes.

insights.bucket_description: No clear pattern, but deviation exceeds threshold
insights.root_cause: Deviations may be caused by unusual transactions or external factors not accounted for.
insights.recommendation: Investigate recent transactions and external factors for any unusual activities.

insights.bucket_description: Consistent increase or decrease in outstanding balances
insights.root_cause: This could be due to changes in business operations or policy adjustments.
insights.recommendation: Review business operations and policies to identify potential causes.

insights.root_cause: Reversals or corrections may have been made to rectify previous errors.
insights.recommendation: Verify the accuracy of reversal or correction entries and ensure they are justified.

insights.bucket_description: Outstanding balances are not in line with previous months
insights.root_cause: Discrepancies could be due to seasonal variations or errors in previous records.
insights.recommendation: Analyze historical data for seasonal trends or errors in past records.

insights.bucket_description: Gradual deviation beyond threshold over multiple periods
insights.root_cause: Gradual deviations may indicate underlying systemic issues.
insights.recommendation: Conduct a root cause analysis to identify systemic issues affecting balances.

insights.bucket_description: High volatility in account balances over time
insights.root_cause: High volatility may be due to market fluctuations or inconsistent financial practices.
insights.recommendation: Implement measures to stabilize financial practices and mitigate market impacts.
